body:
I get a confusing but benign message from spack when staging chombo...

```
[scratlantis:~/spack/spack] miller86% spack stage chombo@3.2
==> Trying to clone git repository: http://bitbucket.org/drhansj/chombo-xsdk.git at commit 71d856c
==> No checksum needed when fetching with git
==> Already staged chombo-3.2-2tfom3zbqdc24bfafe7ybfc44yftvbtc in /Users/miller86/spack/spack/var/spack/stage/chombo-3.2-2tfom3zbqdc24bfafe7ybfc44yftvbtc
```

The part that is strange is the `Already staged chombo-3.2...` message. I made sure I removed it from `cache` cdir and removed all instances of it in `stage` dir. Nonetheless, this message always comes up. I think its a bug resulting from the particular fetch strategy that Chombo uses.
title: Odd message while staging chombo
